I‚Äôm constantly annoyed by all car reviewers who all seem to judge every car by its inclusion or lack of a sporty nature. All cars have a mission; minivans=kid hauler, sedans=family car, convertibles=fun, etc.  Yes, a car can have multiple attributes, but every car will compromise those things that are outside of its primary purpose. I don‚Äôt expect a Porsche 911 GT2 to get the economy of a Ford Fiesta - that‚Äôs not its mission. 

As for the Mustang convertible, it‚Äôs a cruiser with sporty intentions - especially with the 4-banger. But at its price point, you‚Äôd be hard pressed to find something that offers the same fun per dollar which means there are compromises in materials, etc.
